Package util.patterns.commonObj

Class CommonObjectivePattern

java.lang.Object
util.patterns.commonObj.CommonObjectivePattern
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColumnPattern, CornerPattern, DiagonalPattern, RowPattern, SingleCellPattern, SquarePattern, StairPattern, XPattern
public abstract class CommonObjectivePattern extends Object implements Iterable
Abstract class to implement a common objective pattern

    • verifyWithSameType

      public int verifyWithSameType(Card[][] shelfMatrix, int maxDifferentTypes)
      Each time the pattern can be completed by different types of cards but everytime they need to be less than maxDifferentTypes different types of cards. If the pattern is bigger than the shelf it will always return 0. If the pattern is not complete (in at least one of the pattern's cell there's no card). the pattern won't be satisfied.
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is the shelf as array of Card
      maxDifferentTypes - is the maximum number of different types
      Returns:
      how many times the given card matrix satisfies the pattern with at most maxDifferentTypes different types of cards

    • verifyWithSameTypeMirrored

      public int verifyWithSameTypeMirrored(Card[][] shelfMatrix, int maxDifferentTypes)
      Does verifyWithSameType but with the pattern mirrored vertically
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is the array of Cards that represents the shelf
      maxDifferentTypes - is the number of maximum different types
      Returns:
      the number of maximum different types

    • verifyWithDifferentType

      public int verifyWithDifferentType(Card[][] shelfMatrix, int minDifferentTypes)

    • verifyListMinTypes

      protected boolean verifyListMinTypes(List<Card.Type> typeList, Card.Type type, int minDifferentTypes)
      Checks that the given type and the types in the list are at least minDifferentTypes different types If the type is not found it will be added to the list
      Parameters:
      typeList - is a list of Card
      type - is a type of the card
      minDifferentTypes - is the number of different type
      Returns:
      true if the number of types are greater or equal to maxDifferentTypes

    • invertPattern

      protected void invertPattern()
      Inverts the pattern

    • verifyPatternAndAntiPattern

      public boolean verifyPatternAndAntiPattern(Card[][] shelfMatrix)
      Checks if the pattern selected and the mirrored pattern is verified
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is an array of Card representing the shelf
      Returns:
      true if the given matrix contains cards of any type only in the pattern, false otherwise

    • verifyPatternAndAntiPatternCore

      public boolean verifyPatternAndAntiPatternCore(Card[][] shelfMatrix)
      Checks if the pattern selected is
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is an array of Card representing the shelf
      Returns:
      true if the given matrix contains cards of any type only in the pattern, false otherwise

    • verifyPatternWithOneCardCore

      public int verifyPatternWithOneCardCore(Card[][] shelfMatrix)
      Only use this method for patterns that can't be rotated such as columns and rows. For symmetric patterns such as squares or Xes use the not Core version as this method might not find the maximum appearance value
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is an array of Card representing the shelf
      Returns:
      the maximum amount of times a pattern can be completed with the same type of card

    • verifyPatternWithOneCard

      public int verifyPatternWithOneCard(Card[][] shelfMatrix)
      Does verifyPatternWithOneCardCore but As some pattern might be overlapped and exploration from the left up corner might not find the max amount of appearance of that pattern. To fix this method rotate the matrix 4 times to explore all the possible combinations NOTE for patterns that are not symmetric by 90° rotations such as columns and rows do not use this method
      Parameters:
      shelfMatrix - is an array of Card representing the shelf
      Returns:
      the occurrences of the pattern in the shelf
